unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked why Indian news channels are obsessed with astrology? Dude, I’ve been wondering that since like, forever! It's 2024, not 1724, right? You'd think we'd be talking about, like, I dunno, real news?

unnormalised: Honestly, it's baffling. I mean, you flip on the TV at 7:00 PM IST, expecting to hear about the latest scams or maybe, just maybe, a tiny bit of good news. Nope! Instead, it's "Aaj ka rashifal" with some guru predicting if your day will be good based on, like, where the planets are? I swear, if Shani dev has a bad day, the whole country apparently suffers.

unnormalised: And the way they dramatize it! "Makar rashi wale log, sambhal ke!" (People of Capricorn, beware!). As if your life is solely dependent on what some star is doing. Last time I checked, my life was more affected by the fact that my auto-rickshaw driver charged me Rs. 50 extra because of "traffic".

unnormalised: I think they do it because it's cheap and easy content. Hire one astrologer, throw some graphics up on the screen, and boom, you've got 30 minutes of airtime filled. Plus, let's be real, a lot of people in India actually believe in this stuff. It's comforting, I guess, to think there's some cosmic plan at work instead of just, you know, the chaos of everyday life.
